author: Special Correspondent
text:
A middle-aged man was on Wednesday sentenced to seven years imprisonment by First Additional Sessions Judge for murdering his father due to a quarrel over a financial issue during 2014.

Thangaraj (47), a labourer of Ammapalayam along Arachalur Road in Chennimalai limits, had hacked Asai Arokiam (75) fatally over the objection the latter had expressed over the former getting money from his (Thangaraj’s) nephew and niece, who were employed in a textile unit. Charles and Elizabeth Rani were living with their grandfather after their mother’s death.

Asai Arokiam, who sustained cut injuries on head in the attack by his son on June 11, 2014, died soon after admission at GH.
title: Man gets seven years imprisonment for murdering father
